content.question: A <math alttext="500 decimal point milliliters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>500.</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>mL</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> aqueous solution of <math alttext="N a 3 P O 4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Na</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>PO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="molar mass equals 164 grams per mole" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>(molar</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>mass</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>=</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>164</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>g/</mtext><mtext>mol)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> was prepared using <math alttext="82 grams" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>82</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>g</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of the solute. What is the molarity of <math alttext="N a 3 P O 4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Na</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>PO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> in the resulting solution?

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
